# Scale: Harmonic in F (Mode: Locrian #6, Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation

The Harmonic in F scale is a seven-note scale derived from the F Harmonic Minor scale. In this specific variation, known as the Locrian #6 mode, the 6th degree is raised by a half step compared to the regular Locrian mode. When played starting from the note C, it creates an interesting and exotic sound due to its unique intervals and structure.

## Notes and Intervals

The Harmonic in F scale in the Locrian #6 mode, starting from C, consists of the following notes and intervals:

- C (Root)
- Db (Minor 2nd)
- Ebb (Diminished 3rd)
- F (4th)
- Gb (Diminished 5th)
- Ab (Minor 6th)
- B (Major 7th)

This scale contains a series of minor and diminished intervals, contributing to its distinctive and somewhat dissonant sound.

## Genre and Musical Flavor

The Harmonic in F scale, particularly in the Locrian #6 mode, is not commonly used in mainstream music but is frequently employed in jazz, fusion, and experimental genres. Its unsettling yet captivating sound adds tension and complexity to compositions, making it a favorite among musicians looking to create a darker and more mysterious musical atmosphere.
